comments.body: I still think you should consider adding documentation here to tell users how to use it optimally ;)
He he, sorry I didn't do it, this is my first PR in definitelytyped and wasn't sure where the docs are, I'll have it in mind next time, thanks
This is the main change, rest is test and related package updates.
What's the point of types if it's just an any? This should be generic if at all possible.

https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped#common-mistakes
This shouldnt be interface without properties. It needs to be either object or any

As mentioned in the PR description, this is very much intentional. The `User` and `AuthInfo` properties can be augmented by users depending on how Express is used, and this can only be done in a type safe matter with an interface. If it's `any` or an `object`, it cannot be extended. For more details, see: https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/declaration-merging.html

For our use case, this is leading to type conflicts because we're setting `user` to have an explicit type when using Passport, and the current declaration of `any` is conflicting with it, because it does not support declaration merging. IMO a third-party package updating Express type declarations should play nicely with it, not be greedy with common properties like `user` and `authInfo` by setting it them to something that cannot be extended.
